btdebuggertool.view

Class GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.zest.layouts.algorithms.AbstractLayoutAlgorithm
      • btdebuggertool.view.GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.zest.layouts.LayoutAlgorithm, org.eclipse.zest.layouts.Stoppable

    public class GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm
extends org.eclipse.zest.layouts.algorithms.AbstractLayoutAlgorithm
    A layout algorithm that spreads the directed graph as a tree from top down first a root is chosen (we offer a default way that may be overridden) then a tree is first spread from that root down in a grid fashion after which it is laid out bottom up to horizontally shift nodes. if the graph contains non connected subgraphs then the process of choosing a root and spreading it's child tree is continued.
    Author:
    ilmta

      wraps a node with useful info like parent and children etc.

      • buildNodeMatrix

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode>> buildNodeMatrix(java.util.List<org.eclipse.zest.layouts.dataStructures.InternalNode> entitiesList,
                                                                                   java.util.List<org.eclipse.zest.layouts.dataStructures.InternalRelationship> relationshipsList)
        Builds the matrix of nodes. each node will be wrapped with necessary innformation such as who are the direct children and parent (only visually in the graph not the actual relationships) the returned matrix is organized more or less as the real tree.
        Parameters:
        entitiesList - - entities to place in the matrix
        relationshipsList - - the relationships between the entities given
        Returns:
        the matrix - (a list of rows of nodes)

      • trimEmptyRows

        private void trimEmptyRows(java.util.List<java.util.List<GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode>> rows)
        Remove rows that are empty. This should only be the last row but since it's not too expensive better safe than sorry.
        Parameters:
        rows - - to trim

      • placeChildless

        private void placeChildless(java.util.List<GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode> childlessStrand,
                  GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode parentLeft,
                  GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode parentRight,
                  int yLoc)
        A childless stran is a "problem" in general because they break the evenness of the tree There are three types of such strands, extra nodes to the left, extra to the right, or extra in between parents. This method places those strands in spot.
        Parameters:
        childlessStrand - - the childless node to be laid out.
        parentLeft - - the nearest parent on the left (or null if none such exists)
        parentRight - - the nearest parent on the right (or null if none such exists)
        yLoc - - the vertical location to lay out the nodes on.

                         int shift)
        Shifts the trees right of mark node
        Parameters:
        mark - to shift from
        shift - - factor by which to move right by.

        private void placeStrand(java.util.List<GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode> strand,
               int x,
               int y,

        Places the list of nodes horizontally at the given point and spaced on horizontally by given spacing.
        Parameters:
        strand - - list of nodes to be laid out.
        x - - location to begin the placing
        y - - vertical location to lay out the entire list.
        spacing - the horizontal spacing between nodes.

      • builtTreeFromRoot

        private void builtTreeFromRoot(GXTreeLayoutAlgorithm.GXMoreThanNode currRoot,

        follows the root by all its children to wrap the all up with all the extra info needed and adds the tree to the matrix.
        Parameters:
        currRoot - - root to go over tree from
        entitiesList - - entities available
        relationshipsList - - relationship between the given entities
        currRow - - the current row in the matrix we are working on
        rows - - the matrix.
